title: An Automated Pipeline for Few-Shot Bird Call Classification, a Case Study with the Tooth-Billed Pigeon
author: Abhishek Jana (Colossal Biosciences), Moeumu Uili (Colorado State University), James Atherton (BirdLife International), Mark O'Brien (Toledo Zoo), Joe Wood (Toledo Zoo), Leandra Brickson (Colossal Biosciences), ...
relevance_why: The paper develops a novel few-shot classification pipeline which could be applied to audio event detection tasks, such as speaker recognition or specific sound detection with limited audio samples.
background: The study aims to classify calls of rare bird species using only a handful of audio recordings, addressing the challenges posed by limited data availability in conservation scenarios.
contribution: This paper introduces a few-shot bird call classification pipeline to solve the problem of detecting rare species calls from minimal audio data, achieving high recall and accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models like BirdNET and Perch have shown high accuracy for common species but struggle with rare species due to insufficient training data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs embedding spaces from large models and a cosine similarity-based classifier tailored for minimal data, improving performance for rare species detection.

key_innovation: Utilizes a targeted detection pipeline that combines advanced preprocessing and clustering techniques with minimal training data to maximize detection accuracy.
real_world_impact: This system can significantly aid conservation efforts by providing a practical tool for detecting rare bird species, potentially impacting efforts to monitor endangered populations.
limitations: The model's efficacy is contingent on available sound recordings and may be affected by species-specific acoustic similarity, as evidenced by its reliance on existing classifiers.

new_terms.few-shot classification: **Few-shot classification** refers to machine learning approaches that learn from only a few training examples, often utilized in scenarios where data is scarce.

open_sourcing: The end-to-end pipeline is publicly available at https://github.com/colossal-compsci/few-shot-bird-call
